meanings.definition: a type of fishing equipment used to catch fish
meanings.sent1: The fishermen loaded their trawleys onto the boat before heading out to sea.
meanings.sent2: The trawleys were essential for the fishermen to catch a lot of fish.
meanings.sent3: When the trawleys got tangled, the fishermen had to work together to untangle them.
meanings.sent4: The trawleys danced in the water, capturing fish like skilled hunters.
meanings.sent5: The shiny trawleys glistened in the sunlight, ready to scoop up the fish below.

meanings.sent1: The fishermen trawleys in the deep ocean for a big catch.
meanings.sent2: They trawleys carefully to avoid damaging the delicate ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: As the boat rocked, the fishermen trawleys with precision and skill.
meanings.sent4: She trawleys with such expertise that she always brings back a full net.
meanings.sent5: Trawleying requires patience and a good eye for spotting fish in the water.

meanings.definition: a plural form of the word 'trawley'
meanings.sent1: The harbor was filled with colorful trawleys of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: The trawleys lined up along the dock, ready for the next fishing expedition.
meanings.sent3: The trawleys chatted amongst themselves, sharing stories of the sea.
meanings.sent4: Each of the trawleys had a unique design, reflecting the personality of its owner.
meanings.sent5: The trawleys bobbed gently in the water, a peaceful sight for onlookers.
